name: KillProcess
friendlyName: Use PowerShell to kill a process
description: Kill a process with name and path
helpMarkDown: Specify the name and the path of the process
author: Comerco

inputs.name: ProcessName
inputs.label: Process Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of a process.
Eg: myRunningFile.

inputs.name: ProcessPath
inputs.label: Path of the process
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path of the source file on the local machine like c:\fabrikamfiber\myRunningFile.exe

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for administrator login for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.
